Text-summarize the provided passage.

Smallpox is an infectious disease caused by the variola virus. Symptoms of smallpox include a fever, fatigue, and a distinctive rash. Smallpox is believed to have first appeared in human populations around 10,000 BCE. Throughout history, the disease has caused large-scale epidemics and mortality, particularly in the 18th and 19th centuries. By 1980, the disease had been effectively eradicated worldwide due to a successful global vaccination program.
